name: Fresh Strawberry
preparation:
“The current mainstream of Japanese cocktail making is to combine the spirits with fresh ingredients, rather than using liqueur or flavored syrup” says barman Naofumi Yokoyama of his two-and-a-half-year-old Bar Entrust, the Third Place in Tokyo’s Ginza neighborhood. He offers a concise collection of cocktails built from pristine seasonal fruit, like this cocktail made with fresh strawberries.

This recipe originally appeared as part of “The Secret to Neo-Japanese Bartending Is Fresh Fruit.”

In a shaker, muddle the strawberries to release juice.

Add the remaining ingredients with ice and shake.

Strain into a coupe or Nick & Nora glass.

Garnish with a strawberry slice (optional).
